intro: Schedonorus uechtritzianus, commonly known as the European meadow grass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, pastures, and woodland edges. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often slightly hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Poaceae family. Schedonorus uechtritzianus plays an important role in maintaining biodiversity in grassland ecosystems.
